content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return strip(lowercase(replace(col, r"[- ]+" => "_")))
end
```

This function does the following:

1. `strip` removes any leading or trailing whitespace from the string.
2. `lowercase` converts the entire string to lowercase.
3. `replace(col, r"[- ]+" => "_")` replaces one or more occurrences of hyphens (`-`) and spaces (` `) with an underscore (`_`) using a regular expression.

The function returns the cleaned column name as a lowercased string with no leading or trailing whitespace and with spaces and hyphens replaced by underscores.
